refnamediv.refpurpose: Report important messages to the user

refsynopsisdiv.title: Synopsis

refsect1.title: Implemented Interfaces
refsect1.para: GtkMessageArea implements AtkImplementorIface, GtkBuildable and GtkOrientable.

refsect1.title: Style Properties
refsect1.synopsis: "action-area-border" gint : Read "button-spacing" gint : Read "content-area-border" gint : Read "content-area-spacing" gint : Read "use-tooltip-style" gboolean : Read

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: GtkMessageArea is a widget that can be used to show messages to the user without showing a dialog. It is often temporarily shown at the top or bottom of a document. In contrast to GtkDialog, which has a horizontal action area at the bottom, GtkMessageArea has a vertical action area at the side.

The API of GtkMessageArea is very similar to GtkDialog, allowing you to add buttons to the action area with gtk_message_area_add_button() or gtk_message_area_new_with_buttons(). The sensitivity of action widgets can be controlled with gtk_message_area_set_response_sensitive(). To add widgets to the main content area of a GtkMessageArea, use gtk_message_area_set_contents().

Similar to GtkMessageDialog, the contents of a GtkMessageArea can by classified as error message, warning, informational message, etc, by using gtk_message_area_set_message_type(). GTK+ uses the message type to determine the background color of the message area.

refsect2.title: GtkMessageArea as GtkBuildable
refsect2.para: The GtkMessageArea implementation of the GtkBuildable interface exposes the content area and action area as internal children with the names "content_area" and "action_area".

GtkMessageArea supports a custom <action-widgets> element, which can contain multiple <action-widget> elements. The "response" attribute specifies a numeric response, and the content of the element is the id of widget (which should be a child of the dialogs action_area).

refsect2.title: gtk_message_area_new_with_buttons ()
refsect2.para: Creates a new GtkMessageArea with buttons. Button text/response ID pairs should be listed, with a NULL pointer ending the list. Button text can be either a stock ID such as GTK_STOCK_OK, or some arbitrary text. A response ID can be any positive number, or one of the values in the GtkResponseType enumeration. If the user clicks one of these dialog buttons, GtkMessageArea will emit the "response" signal with the corresponding response ID.

listitem.simpara: stock ID or text to go in first button, or NULL
response ID for first button, then additional buttons, ending with NULL

refsect2.title: gtk_message_area_set_contents ()
refsect2.para: Adds the contents widget to the contents area of GtkMessageArea.

listitem.simpara: widget you want to add to the contents area

refsect2.title: gtk_message_area_add_action_widget ()
refsect2.para: Add an activatable widget to the action area of a GtkMessageArea, connecting a signal handler that will emit the "response" signal on the message area when the widget is activated. The widget is appended to the end of the message areas action area.

refsect2.title: gtk_message_area_add_button ()
refsect2.para: Adds a button with the given text (or a stock button, if button_text is a stock ID) and sets things up so that clicking the button will emit the "response" signal with the given response_id. The button is appended to the end of the message area's action area. The button widget is returned, but usually you don't need it.

listitem.simpara: text of button, or stock ID
the button widget that was added

refsect2.title: gtk_message_area_add_buttons ()
refsect2.para: Adds more buttons, same as calling gtk_message_area_add_button() repeatedly. The variable argument list should be NULL-terminated as with gtk_message_area_new_with_buttons(). Each button must have both text and response ID.

listitem.simpara: response ID for first button, then more text-response_id pairs, ending with NULL

refsect2.title: gtk_message_area_set_response_sensitive ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gtk_message_area_set_response_sensitive (GtkMessageArea *message_area, gint response_id, gboolean setting);
refsect2.para: Calls gtk_widget_set_sensitive (widget, setting) for each widget in the dialog's action area with the given response_id. A convenient way to sensitize/desensitize dialog buttons.

refsect2.title: gtk_message_area_set_default_response ()
refsect2.para: Emits the 'response' signal with the given response_id.

refsect2.title: gtk_message_area_set_message_type ()
refsect2.para: Sets the message type of the message area. GTK+ uses this type to determine what color to use when drawing the message area.

refsect2.title: gtk_message_area_get_message_type ()
refsect2.para: Returns the message type of the message area.

listitem.simpara: the message type of the message area.

refsect2.title: The "message-type" property
refsect2.para: The type is used to determine the colors to use in the message area. The following symbolic color names can by used to customize these colors: "info_fg_color", "info_bg_color", "warning_fg_color", "warning_bg_color", "question_fg_color", "question_bg_color", "error_fg_color", "error_bg_color", "other_fg_color", "other_bg_color".

refsect2.title: The "action-area-border" style property
refsect2.para: Width of the border around the action area of the message area.

refsect2.title: The "button-spacing" style property
refsect2.para: Spacing between buttons in the action area of the message area.

refsect2.title: The "content-area-border" style property
refsect2.para: The width of the border around the content content area of the message area.

refsect2.title: The "content-area-spacing" style property
refsect2.para: The default spacing used between elements of the content area of the message area.

refsect2.title: The "use-tooltip-style" style property
refsect2.para: When TRUE, use the same background/foreground color as GtkTooltip. Otherwise, GTK+ uses "message-type" to determine which symbolic colors to use.

refsect2.title: The "close" signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (GtkMessageArea *arg0, gpointer user_data) : Run Last / Action
refsect2.para: The ::close signal is a keybinding signal which gets emitted when the user uses a keybinding to dismiss the message area
The default binding for this signal is the Escape key.

listitem.simpara: user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The "response" signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (GtkMessageArea *message_area, gint response_id, gpointer user_data) : Run Last
refsect2.para: Emitted when an action widget is clicked or the application programmer calls gtk_dialog_response(). The response_id depends on which action widget was clicked.

listitem.simpara: the object on which the signal is emitted
user data set when the signal handler was connected.
